skills.label: Understand how data is stored in tables
items: Understand what a table is and how it relates to the data that will be stored in the database

skills.label: Understand relational database concepts
items: Understand what a relational database is, the need for relational database management systems (rdbms), and how relations are established

skills.label: Understand data manipulation language (DML)
items: Understand what dml is and its role in databases

skills.label: Understand data definition language (DDL)
items: Understand how t-sql can be used to create database objects, such as tables and views

skills.label: Choose data types
items: Understand what data types are, why they are important, and how they affect storage requirements

skills.label: Understand tables and how to create them
items: Create tables in a database by using proper ansi sql syntax

skills.label: Create views
items: Understand when to use views and how to create a view by using t-sql or a graphical designer

skills.label: Create stored procedures and functions
items: Select, insert, update, or delete data

skills.label: Select data
items: Utilize select queries to extract data from one table, extract data by using joins, combine result sets by using union and intersect

skills.label: Insert data
items: Understand how data is inserted into a database, how to use insert statements

skills.label: Update data
items: Understand how data is updated in a database and how to write the updated data to the database by using the appropriate update statements, update by using a table

skills.label: Delete data
items: Delete data from single or multiple tables, ensure data and referential integrity by using transactions

skills.label: Understand normalization
items: Understand the reasons for normalization, the five most common levels of normalization, how to normalize a database to third normal form

skills.label: Understand primary, foreign, and composite keys
items: Understand the reason for keys in a database, choose appropriate primary keys, select appropriate data type for keys, select appropriate fields for composite keys, understand the relationship between foreign and primary keys

skills.label: Understand indexes
items: Understand clustered and non-clustered indexes and their purpose in a database

skills.label: Understand database security concepts
items: Understand the need to secure a database, what objects can be secured, what objects should be secured, user accounts, and roles

skills.label: Understand database backups and restore
items: Understand various backup types, such as full and incremental, importance of backups, how to restore a database
